potential_projects.content_snippet:
Gross Goods and Services Tax (GST) collections rose 16.4 per cent year-on-year to Rs 2.01 lakh crore in May (for sales in April), data released by the government on Sunday showed. potential_projects.title: Powin could cease operations by end of July if ‘present business circumstances do not improve’
potential_projects.content_snippet:
In a letter addressed to Michael Welter, rapid response coordinator at Oregon’s Higher Education Coordinating Commission (HECC), and the mayors of Portland and Tualatin, where its operations are based, Powin said it faces the possibility of having to close and lay off 250 staff.

“If Powin LLC’s present business circumstances do not improve, it is currently anticipated that a layoff will occur on or before 28 July 2025,” the letter, signed by Powin’s VP for human resources, Scott Getman, read.

potential_projects.content_snippet:
A consortium comprising EDF Power Solutions and Korea Western Power Company (KOWEPO) has signed a Joint Development Agreement (JDA) for the 1.5 gigawatts (GW) Al Zarraf Solar PV Independent Power Producer (IPP) project in Abu Dhabi.

potential_projects.title: Arctech Secures Strategic Deal with ACME to Supply Solar Trackers for 300 MTPD Green Ammonia Project in Duqm
potential_projects.content_snippet:
Global solar technology provider Arctech has signed a strategic agreement with India-based renewable energy firm ACME Cleantech Solutions to supply 175 MWp of its Skyline II single-axis solar trackers for the 300 MTPD Green Ammonia Project in Duqm, Oman.

The project will be one of the first large-scale green hydrogen production facilities in the Middle East and will rely on solar PV to generate the clean electricity needed to produce green ammonia.
